timeline.message: Adding and expanding logging in IconPackage
Adding null guarded assignment for image items
Fixing a potential null issue with image label assignment
Adding some defensive code for refits
Fixing object and string comparison issues

timeline.bodyText: I guess we don't need the enclosing parens if there's no !=
timeline.author: NickAragua
NickAragua

timeline.bodyText: I don't see a reason to eliminate the VEENOVA logic.
timeline.author: NickAragua

replies.bodyText: Unused and has never been used, years after it was originally implemented.
replies.author: Windchild292

timeline.bodyText: Do we really want a non-null person in case we fail to read a person in?
timeline.author: NickAragua

replies.bodyText:
We already will have a non-null person, as the only way it will return null currently is if it fails to create the person object initially.
However, by adding retVal = null on the catch would do that, which seems to have been the original intent in the code. Pushed a fix to ensure the original intent works.
replies.author: Windchild292

timeline.bodyText: I think reference equality is okay here actually. We wouldn't want two instances with the same UUID. In any case this is safe for now.
timeline.author: sixlettervariables

replies.bodyText: It is okay for now, but I'd rather future proof and implement it properly with equals comparisons.
replies.author: Windchild292

timeline.bodyText: Should have a reference equality check first.
timeline.author: sixlettervariables

replies.bodyText: Part of the recommendations for implementing Object::equals.
replies.author: sixlettervariables

timeline.message: Implementing object comparison equality for Person::equals
